title: SMC_GroupReadSetPosition (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK SMC_GroupReadSetPosition
This function block returns the set-position of an axis group
in the selected coordinate system.
Typically, this will be the set-position from the end of the previous
cycle.  In order to obtain the set-position from the end of the current
cycle,
SMC_GroupUpdate
has to be called before this function block,
or a
TimeOffset
equal to the task interval has to be supplied.
This is an administrative FB, since no movement is generated.

rows.Name: AxisGroup
rows.Comment: Reference to a group of axes

rows.Name: Enable
rows.Comment:
Get the position in the selected coordinate system of the
axis group continuously while enabled

rows:
The time offset in seconds when to evaluate the position.
Relative to the start of the current cycle.
Must be in [0,fPlanningForecastDuration].fPlanningForecastDurationcan be configured usingSMC_TuneCPKernel.Time offsets > 0 are only supported ifthe offset does not exceed theCurrentPlanningForecastreported byMC_GroupReadStatus, andMC_GroupHalt/MC_GroupStop/MC_GroupInterruptare not active.
Signals that an error has occurred within the function block

Kinematic configuration of current position.
Only set if the coordinate system is cartesian (i.e. not set for ACS)
Automatic periods are activated for any rotary axis with multiple periods.
SeeSMC_KinConfigActivateAutomaticPeriodsfor more information.
A kinematic configuration without automatic periods can be obtained by
reading an ACS position and converting it to the MCS usingSMC_GroupConvertPosition.
Current positions of the groupâs additional axes.
